s.text: During the comment period APHIS also held four public hearings at which both oral and written comments were received.
APHIS states that these estimates are dependent on both the amount of fresh pork imported and on consumer reaction to the Mexican pork products.

Based on the number and complexity of the comments, APHIS decided to issue only a small portion of the proposed rule at this time and to review and reanalyze the other portions of the rule before issuing them as final.

Pursuant to section 801(a)(2)(A) of title 5, United States Code, this is our report on a major rule promulgated by the Department of Agriculture, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, entitled "Importation of Pork from Sonora, Mexico" (RIN: 0579-AA71).

Pursuant to section 801(a)(2)(A) of title 5, United States Code, this is our report on a major rule promulgated by the Department of Agriculture, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, entitled "Importation of Pork from Sonora, Mexico" (RIN: 0579-AA71).

Pursuant to section 801(a)(2)(A) of title 5, United States Code, this is our report on a major rule promulgated by the Department of Agriculture, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, entitled "Importation of Pork from Sonora, Mexico" (RIN: 0579-AA71).
The assigned OMB control number is 0579-0015.
